data.title: CC_SPRITE_DEBUG_DRAW does nothing in Cocos2d-x 3.7
data.body:
I set CC_SPRITE_DEBUG_DRAW to 1 and to 2 and it does nothing. Not sure if there is something else I have to do but this looks like a bug.

From what I can tell, in 3.6 the DrawNode used to draw the outline of sprites is refreshed during each draw call, so it always uses the latest vertex data when drawing the outline. In 3.7, the DrawNode is created and set once. Unfortunately this is done in the constructor of the Sprite before texture data is set, so the triangle count is always 0 and no outline is drawn.

Calling `debugDraw(true);` immediately after `_polyInfo.setQuad(&_quad);` works for me, surrounded by `#if CC_SPRITE_DEBUG_DRAW` of course.

data.title: DrawNode -> needs optimization, frame rate drops dramatically.
data.body:
1. create a scene, run it, 60fps
2. add a few calls to cocos2d::DrawNode::create(); any, really, drawTriangle, drawDot, etc
3. add then to your scene

watch the frame rate tank considerably. 

I have a Scene with 5 `DrawNode` objects and the frame rate is 18fps

OS X 10.10.5, Cocos2d-x v3.6 and v3.7, ios simulator and hardware.

data.title: V3: Windows 10 UWP and WP8.1 app certification fixes
data.body: This pull request updates the Win10 UWP projects to correctly build with the final release version of Visual Studio 2015. Changes were made to the Windows 10 UWP cpp template files so it can pass the Windows App Certification (WACK) tests. The Windows 8.1 cpp templates were also updated to pass the latest WACK tests.
